alert.note: Alert for Cobb (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 04 at 10:25PM EDT by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Cobb County through 1100 PM EDT... At 1024 PM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was over Jim Miller Park, or near Marietta, moving west at 10 mph. HAZARD...Up to 40 mph wind, frequent cloud to ground lightning and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect minor damage to tree limbs and blowing around of light, unsecured objects. Heavy rain may cause temporary street flooding especially in poor drainage areas. Locations impacted include... Marietta, Smyrna, Kennesaw, Acworth, Powder Springs, Fair Oaks, White Water Park, Lost Mountain Park, Kennesaw State University, Jim R Miller Park, Due West, Sandy Plains and Dobbins Air Reserve Base. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: People outdoors should seek shelter immediately. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Motorists should slow down and be prepared for possible loss of control due to hydroplaning.
